properties.description: Yemeni authorities intercepted a large fishing boat equipped with two 40-hosrspower engines carrying 5 Somalis smuggling weapons, projectiles and explosive charges.
A ship named carrying weapons and ammunition reached the coast of Taiz
Officials seized 2 cars carrying weapons, explosives, and fuel derivatives.
Officials seized a car carrying rifles and ammunition
Security authorities discovered an attempt to import a large amount of ammunition from China, using (possibly) forged official documents from the Yemeni Ministry of Defense
Military police patrol seized five trucks carrying large quantities of explosives, fuel and gas cylinders hidden under a shipment of fruits and vegetables.
Three arms dealers were arrested in Baqim for supplying terrorists with weapons, ammunition, and explosives
A high security official in al-jawf province said they thwarted daily between 10 to 20 trucks carrying food or feed to hide oil derivatives or weapons being smuggled to terrorist elements
the Yemeni government arrested five Iranians and one Indian on board an Iranian ship carrying weapons off the coast of northern Yemen.
An Iranian ship loaded with weapons was seized in Midi.
Yemeni Coast Guard forces arrested a fishing boat with 8 Somalis carrying 2 RPGs as well as light and medium weapons
A car belonging to the terrorists and about 40 anti-armour landmines were seized
Arms caches belonging to Mana'a reportedly came under aerial bombardment
Arms caches belonging to Mana'a reportedly came under aerial bombardment

Weapons and explosives were seized in the house of Hisham Bashraheel (head of Al-Ayam newspaper). Al-Ayam newspaper was not on good trerms with Saleh. The govt. had attacked the newspaper before. This probably didn't actually have anything to do with the arms trade, and was more a pretext to arrest Bashraheel.

A weapon store, cars laden with weapons and ammunitions, and some Houthi rebels' hideout were destroyed in Harf Sufyan and Al-Malaheidh. Houthi rebels' weapon store and two cars laden with weapons were destroyed in Al Kheyam village in Harf Sufyan
A commercial fishing ship carrying weapons was arrested in off the coast of Aden

Gunfights between security forces and followers of Hassan Mana'a and the imprisoned Faris Manna, an accused arms dealer, and between security forces. First, there was a gunfight between security forces and Mana'a's supporters trying to free him on his way to criminal court. Second, security forces wanted Hassan to hand over a number of wanted men from his house and a gunfight erupted.
Security services seized a car with 8 people in it carrying ammunition for various medium weapons.
Saudi authorities intercepted people on foot trying to smuggle weapons into Saudi Arabia
A car carrying 1605 Makarov pistols and silencers was seized in Sa'ada
The Djibouti navy seized a ship aiming to deliver weapons to the Houthis.
S.A. border gaurds in Jazan caught smugglers with weapons and ammuntion in bags on their backs coming from Yemen
The Saudi Navy seized a small ship loaded with various weapons going to the Houthis
Saudi authorities intercepted a car with five people trying to smuggle drugs and weapons into Saudi Arabia
5 people with weapons and bombs were seized at a Sana'a hotel
Yemeni naval forces seized an Iranian ship near Socotra

4 people in a car carrying weapons and bombs were arrested going to Sana'a University. They also had a tent and logos for the JMP, so this is prbably political and has nothing to do with arms trafficking
16,000 Turkish-made pistols were seized in Dubai going to Sa'ada

30 armed and hooded gunmen stormed three sites in and near Jaar, including the ammunition factory, and made off in four vehicles with cases of weapons. The next day, looters picking through the leftovers set off an explosion that killed around 100 people.
A Border Guard officer was killed by Yemeni arms and drugs smugglers in the area of Al-Majaza in Dhahran Al-Junoub. One smuggler was injured in the clash, while five others escaped
Border gaurds in Jazan tried to intercept smugglers carying 72 guns and 1400 rounds inside bags. When the border guard moved to intercept the smugglers, they dropped their bags and fled.
100 Kalashnikovs were seized aboard a car in Hodeida
Weapons were seized hidden on a waste transportation car in Sana'a.
Two ships containing Russian small and medium arms
A car carrying guns and ammunition was seized outside the city of Mukalla
A car carrying weapons and explosives was seized.
Two arms shipements sent by the ministry of defense to manage security in Aden disappeared.
Aden security seized explosives and weapons while conducting a raid of a house in Sheikh Othman neighborhood of Aden
Authroities intercepted a ship carrying Iranian heavy weapons.
A car carrying three people and explosives was seized in Lahajj

Over the two days it took for Gen. Mahdi Maqoula to leave his post as the top military commander in the south, ammunition and weapons from a military storehouse, including a supply of sophisticated sniper scopes, disappeared. He alledgedly spent those two days taking the weapons.

Alledgedly, 3 trucks carrying weapons were allowed through a checkpoint by order of Gen. Mahdi, Maqoula and two days before the al-qaeda attack on Dofus, Mahdi sent a truck loaded with ammunition to an unknown location
Police found weapons, projectiles, and ammunitions believed to belong to al-Qaeda on a truck in Aden.
A car with Saudi plates carrying weapons was seized in Dali'.
A military officer took 410 artillery shells from the South's armory and gave them to units of Ansar Al Sharia in Abyan governorate
Weapons and explosives were seized on a car
A car carrying weapons and explosives was seized at the gate of the Southern Military Command
weapons, grenades and explosives were seized in a taxi in Sana'a as it passed the Saudi embassy
Weapons and explosives were seized on a jeep with a Gulf license plate
A Turkish ship coming from Ukraine unloaded a large shipment of weapons in Hodeida. There aren't other reports of this, so it didn't definitely happen.
A car carrying weapons and explosive materials was seized in Hajjah
The Border Guard in Jazan Region of SA arrested a person attempting to smuggle weapons into Saudi Arabia from Yemen concealed in his car
The Somali government of Puntland intercepted at sea a speedboat with two motors carrying rockets, explosives, shells and ammunitions from Yemen to Somalia.
4-5 containers of pisols without barells with links to dealers in Saada were stuck in the Port of Djibouti, or possibly Port Said. This might not be accurate.
Two cars carrying 18 thousand weapons were seized on their way to Saada.
Saudi border guards captured two smugglers carrying weapons and ammunition
A car carrying two terrorist s and explosives between Marib and Hadhramaut was destroyed.
Saudi Border Guards in Jazan province intercepted smugglers carrying 196 guns with 196 magazines
The Saudi Border Guard caught five Arab nationals trying to smuggle three machine guns and more than 10,000 bullets into the Kingdom from across the Yemen border.
Explosion of a weapons depots in Mahra
Two al-Qaeda members were seized in their car at the entrace to Aden, and when their house was searched, weapons and explosives were found
A shell fired hit a weapons depot in the First Armored Division camp and set off a series of explosions
Puntland seized weapons destined for al Shabaab rebels that came off a fiberglass dhow coming from Yemen.
A weapons depot blast killed 3 soldiers and wounded 3 others.
30,000 barrels were seized at Sana'a International Airport. Not sure how accuate this is
A ship carrying Iranian-weapons, explosives, and US dollars was seized off the coast of Aden. On board the ship were Somali gunmen
A shipment of over 3000 pistols coming from Turkey was seized in the Port of Aden
A car carrying weapons and ammunition was seized in Hodeida. The car was driven by four people

10 Kalashnikovs and 10 clips were seized after a half hour exchange of fire between border gaurds and smugglers. The smugglers were crossing into SA on foot. They were coming into SA from Sada'a by way of the qameesha area.
Weapons were seized on a car going from Sa'ada to Bait al-Fiqeeh.
The security checkpoint of Al-Qanawis seized 50 AK-47s in the car of two brothers from Dhamar.
Authorities at Hodeida Port seized nine packages filled with sniper scopes inside a cargo of child diapers imported from China by way of the Port of Jedda.

Gunfire betweem armed guards and rival gunmen acidentally hit an armoury, setting a four-story building ablaze and damaging neighboring buildings. Arms dealer Garman Muhammed Garman owns the house that exploded.
Port of Hodeida security services seized a consignment of security and military equipment arriving on a ship from China.
A truck carrying 5412 Turkish pistols was seized in the Hais directorate in Hodeida
507 sniper scopes and a thousand military cartridges labeled as household tools were seized in Aden
Thousands of rounds hidden inside bananas were seized at the Hais district checkpoint in Hodeida.
Saudi Border gaurds in Rabooa'a got in a shootout with people smuggling ammunitition
Sniper rifles and night vision goggles were discovered at the Port of Aden in a container coming from Turkey

A ship carrying 179 tonnes of ammunition and explosives was seized at the Port of Mukalla. The ship was seized 12/18/2012 , loaded with explosives on 7/17/2012 at a greek port (Astakos), then unloaded a container of explosives at a turkish port (Derince), then unloaded 3.5 tons of ammunition in Alexandria, then loaded 4 containers of ammuntion in Aden and transported them to Mombasa, then went to Somalia for a day then Socotra then Aden for 3 days then Mukalla; during the time between greece and mukalla, the ship spent 1.5 months in the waters around Somalia; it was supposed to arrive in Iraq January 7. There’s conflicting reports, some saying the ship came from Iran and some saying it originated from Serbia and was flying the Bolivian flag, or alternatively was flying Kenya and Maldivian flags and was coming from Bari Port, in Montenegro. There's conflicting reports as to whether the weapons final destination was Yemen or the Iraqi sea port of Abu Qaser; or Um Kasri port, Iraq
Motorbike assasins shoot arms dealer Ahmed Muhammed Daghsan
Weapons were found on a car driven by one man at qanawis checkpoint in Hodeida. The car was driven by a man from Bajil directorate
Weapons were found on a car at qanawis checkpoint in Hodeida
Tribal gunmen coming from from Marib Province via the Khowlan line clashed with security personnel. They arrested some of the gunmen as well as seizing three cars loaded with weapons
A bus carrying weapons and munitions coming from the province of Saada, and headed to the province of Aden was seized in Marib province.
Authorities at Hodeida Port seized 10 bags of munitions on a truck bound for Sa'ada coming from the al-birih region in Taiz province
Security forces seized two people at the market in Hodeida carrying bombs and guns
A car carrying 33 kalashnikovs and 7 pistols was seiezed in Hodeida on its way to Sa'ada

Jeehan 1: A 40-ton weapon shipment that was allegedly sent from Iran was seized in a joint operation by the Yemeni coast guards and the US Navy forces in the Arab Sea. However, the Iranian government denied any involvement in this incident. It was crewed by 8 Yemenis, and flew multiple flags. The ship was carrying 73 tons of diesel fuel and 40 different types of explosives and weapons. The weapons were hidden inside four containers concealed by a diesel tank with a capacity of 100,000 liters. Omani authorities had previously detained the ship as it made its way towards Yemen, but they failed to detect the presence of the weapons and explosives. The ship was allgedly destined for Mocha and eventually the Houthis In Sa'ada.

3780 Turkish automatic rifles were found in an unclaimed container in Aden. The weapons arrived in Aden 11/15/2012 and were seized 1/24/2013. The weapons were coming from a Turkish port, possibly Tenbera. The two companies involved are located in Istanbul and Konya
A car carying weapons and ammunition coming from Sa'ada was seized in Hadhramaut
Turkish arms were seized at a military checkpoint at the entrace to the city of Aden

Members of the People's Committees in the coastal area of Shaqra in Abyan province seized a boat with 3 people on board it. They then delivered the crew to the provinces security agency. This boat makes smugling runs between Somalia and Yemen, including weapons smuggling
Explosion of a weapons depot of the 25th Mica brigade stationed in the Abs area
10 hand grenades and mortars, 3 Kalashnikovs, and 150 rounds were seized in a car in Sana'a
A car carrying explosives was seized in Ib province.
A car loaded with weapons was seized in Ibb, coming from Hodeida province on Al-Odeen Al-Gerahee road going to Dali'

Yemeni Coast Guard intercepted a ship carrying 18 Somalis for carrying weapons and fishing without a license. They might have been more illegal fishers than arms smugglers, and the fishing seems to be the thing the Yemeni government is mostly upset about.

Jeehan 2: A ship called the Jeehan 2 was seized while it was unloading weapons into a Yemeni fishing boat. The seizure of the weapons ship was jointly carried out by the Yemeni Naval, Coastal Defense and Coastal Guards and speedboats. The Yemeni government denies this and says the announcement was a result of confusion in understanding the information posted on its website. SadaaNet says the coast gaurd detained two ships in Khoor al-emeera smuggling their weapons cargo to Wahija in Taiz. This might not have happened, or might have nothing to do with the first Iranian ship from 1/23/2012, however the Defense ministry's newssite has an article referencing this incdident and the Jihan 2, also using the Interior Ministry's Information Center as the source.
4 gunmen on a car carrying 2000 shots for Sniper rifles were seized in Aden
A car carrying 600 Turkish made weapons was seized in Amran

a shipment of weapons bearing the made-in Turkey seal concealed inside a bus was seized at a security checkpoint in Amran. The shipment is believed to believed to have entered the country via one of Yemen's sea ports
9 pieces of weapons hidden a bag and 3 people were seized in al-Mahra province
22 different weapons and more than a thousand rounds were seized
Boat carrying 20,000 weapons of Turkish origin entered a gunfight with security personnel as it pulled into harbor
Turkish arms were seized at a military checkpoint after apparently arriving at Mocha Port
Security forces seized a truck carrying Turkish arms concealed in salt
Turkish arms headed for Hunish Archipelago, to be transferred to smaller boats and smuggled in, were seized
